intro: Ecbolium crinitum, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, with a distinctive hairy texture. Ecbolium crinitum produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind, contributing to its spread in arid environments.
